body_html:
While waiting for the official release of TensorFlow with CUDA 9.1, here is another attempt to describe how TensorFlow 1.8 can be built against CUDA 9.1.

The final system configuration will be:

  • OS: Ubuntu 16.04
  • CUDA version: 9.1
  • cuDNN version: 7.1.3
  • NCCL version: 2.1.15
  • Python version: 2.7.12
  • Python install method: virtualenv
  • TensorFlow version: 1.8.0

Troubleshooting for common errors is also added in the article content. I found out that the build process was smooth like sailing a calm ocean (alternative meaning: it can be drowsy to wait for the build to complete).

While waiting for the official release of TensorFlow with CUDA 9.1, [here is another attempt](http://tech.amikelive.com/node-746/guide-installing-tensor-flow-1-8-with-gpu-support-against-cuda-9-1-and-cudnn-7-1-on-ubuntu-16-04/) to describe how TensorFlow 1.8 can be built against CUDA 9.1.

The final system configuration will be:

- OS: Ubuntu 16.04
- CUDA version: 9.1
- cuDNN version: 7.1.3
- NCCL version: 2.1.15
- Python version: 2.7.12
- Python install method: virtualenv
- TensorFlow version: 1.8.0

Troubleshooting for common errors is also added in [the article content](http://tech.amikelive.com/node-746/guide-installing-tensor-flow-1-8-with-gpu-support-against-cuda-9-1-and-cudnn-7-1-on-ubuntu-16-04/). I found out that the build process was smooth like sailing a calm ocean (alternative meaning: it can be drowsy to wait for the build to complete).
